author: Peter Loftus
title: More Prison Inmates Get Access to Hepatitis-C Drugs
text:
Massachusetts state prison officials agreed to expand treatment for inmates with hepatitis C, in the first settlement among several class-action lawsuits accusing state prison systems of denying many prisoners access to costly drugs.
Drugmakers including Gilead Sciences Inc., AbbVie Inc. and Merck & Co. since 2013 have been selling hepatitis C drugs with higher cure rates than older drugs for the disease.
